short_summary: Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) Procurement for Custodial and Janitorial Services (CMHR)
description: The Canadian Museum for Human Rights (CMHR) is seeking proposals for commercial custodial and janitorial services for the museum located in Winnipeg, Manitoba, at 85 Israel Asper Way. Proposals must be submitted electronically through Merx.
full_summary:
# Canadian Museum for Human Rights - Custodial and Janitorial Services

## Government Tender Announcement

The Canadian Museum for Human Rights is soliciting proposals from qualified cleaning service providers for the provision of commercial custodial and janitorial services at its location in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

### Tender Details

* **Reference Number**: MX-43008187709
* **Solicitation Number**: CMHR-1024010
* **Publication Date**: January 17, 2024
* **Tender Closing Date**: February 16, 2024, at 15:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: April 1, 2024
* **Expected Contract End Date**: March 31, 2027

### Service Requirements

The selected contractor must provide a clean, safe, and attractive environment while taking extreme care when working near exhibits, galleries, artifacts, works of art, and equipment.

### Procurement Method

This tender is being conducted using an open bidding process. Bidders may submit their proposals electronically through the Merx website, subject to applicable fees.

### Contact Information

For further information, please contact the Purchasing Department at:
* **Email**: [purchasing@humanrights.ca](mailto:purchasing@humanrights.ca)
* **Phone**: 204-583-2751

## Bid Requirements and Documents

Complete bid documents, including tender specifications and requirements, are available on the Merx website at [https://www.merx.com/public/solicitations/2767905878/abstract?language=EN](https://www.merx.com/public/solicitations/2767905878/abstract?language=EN). Please note that applicants may be required to register for a Merx account to access the bid documents.

## Notice of Trade Agreements

This procurement is subject to the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA). Bidders are required to comply with the terms and conditions of this agreement.
